problem.title: CheckPoint: Maximum Height
problem.script:
from __future__ import division from loncapa import *
a=lc_random(1,3,1) b=lc_random(1,3,1) c=lc_random(1,3,1) d=lc_random(1,3,1) e=lc_random(1,3,1) m=lc_choose(a,0.8,1.2,2.0) k=lc_choose(b,400,600,800) theta=lc_choose(c,20,30,40) x=lc_choose(d,0.12,0.15,0.22) mu=lc_choose(e,0.1,0.2,0.3)
h=0.5* k* x* x/( m*9.8*(1+ mu/math.tan( deg2rad* theta)))
problem.p: A small block of mass $m kg is launched by a compressed spring with force constant k=$k N/m. The initial compression of the spring is $x m. The block slides along a horizontal frictionless surface and then up an inclined plane that make angle \(\theta =\) $theta deg with the horizontal. The coefficient of kinetic friction between the block and the inclined plane is \(\mu_k = \) $mu. Use \( g = 9.8 m/s^2 \).
Find the maximum vertical height h reached by the block.
